summary: This is a memorandum from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General documenting a voluntary interview with a Federal Bureau of Prisons Captain regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The Captain was the Administrative Lieutenant at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York when Epstein was housed there and was responsible for ensuring correctional officers received required training.

keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) was investigating the death of BOP inmate Jeffrey Epstein.
A BOP Captain, who was the Administrative Lieutenant at MCC New York in mid-2019, was interviewed regarding officer training procedures during Epstein's incarceration.
The interview was voluntary, recorded, and transcribed, and took place on October 27, 2021.
Attachments to the memorandum include training sign-in sheets and suicide prevention training materials from the MCC Special Housing Unit (SHU).
The document states it contains neither recommendations nor conclusions, indicating it is a factual record of an interview.
